About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

Hi, i'm Paul.

Born in Mannheim, I've studied Applied Computer Sience in Heidelberg at the Karls-Ruprecht University. I've been coding since 2013, starting with C++ and Java. While studying, I've discovered my passion for agile Development and got to learn various Software-Engineering concepts. Working in a team, having reviews has periodically been in my eyes the right way to develop good and sustainable software. Topics like Containerization, CI/CD are currently my favorite topics since I'm working to get more into DevOps.

Universität Heidelberg

Bachelor's thesis: Semi-automated featuretagging in code

A study showed: Developers are capable of adding Feature-Tags to their Code thus 35% of the code is still untagged. Supporting Developers in tagging their Code, I've developed an automated tool which uses structural and textual code analysis to tag untagged code parts with their corresponding tag.

Lidl GmbH

Workingstudent Sales & Logistics

While studying I've worked as a working student for Lidl GmbH, learning different types of economical and logistical Concepts. I've had great co-workers and costumers and evolved interdisciplinary and social competence.

ZIM Heibelberg

Internship

Me and 5 other students got the chance to develop the prototype for the Master-Patient Index App for "Zentrum für Informations- und Medizintechnik" in Heidelberg. This internship included requirement engineering, stakeholder meetings, development, testing, quality control and release. We've used SCRUM and the prototype was finished after 9 weeks (9 sprints).
